addr: 219 West 40th Street. Third Floor Conference Room. New York, NY 10018
title: "Dying Words" Book Release Party
desc:
Join LGBT advocates, journalists and academics for the "Dying Words: The AIDS Reporting of Jeff Schmalz and How It Transformed the New York Times" book release party -- celebrating the transformational LGBT and AIDS journalism pioneered by former New York Times Editor, Jeffrey Schmalz. The memoir, a project by award-winning author and journalist, Samuel G. Freedman with Kerry Donahue, raised over $28, 451 from a Kickstarter campaign, allowing the idea to come to life.  Join us at CUNY's Graduate School of Journalism in midtown to celebrating the completion of this amazing project; there will be a reception followed by an opportunity to meet the book's authors and purchase a signed copy. This event is leading up to the book's hard release on World AIDS Day -- ?December 1st.? 
 ?" Dying Words: The AIDS Reporting of Jeff Schmalz and How It Transformed the New York Times," ?looks back at the life of Schmalz , a rising star as a young editor at the New York? Times in the 1980s who remained in the closet to his bosses until he collapsed with?AIDS. Outed, he became a courageous and groundbreaking reporter covering AIDS?and gay culture until his death in 1993. His work helped transform the newsrooms?of mainstream U.S. news organizations, especially the Times.
